victim.ante:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (ANTE period - before collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment Context": "Describe road conditions, weather, visibility, traffic density, and surrounding infrastructure.",
  "Observed Vehicles": "Identify all vehicles visible in the scene, their positions, and movement patterns.",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's speed, lane position, and driving behavior leading up to the incident."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by color/type (e.g., "red sedan").
victim.event:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (EVENT period - the collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Incident Report": "Describe the exact sequence of events during the collision. What happened, when, and how?",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's actions, reactions, and any evasive maneuvers attempted during the incident.",
  "Other Vehicle Status": "Describe the behavior and actions of all other vehicles involved in the collision.",
  "Fault Assignment": "Based on visual evidence, provide a reasoned assignment of fault. Explain why a specific vehicle is responsible based on observed behavior and traffic rules."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance. This is the MOST IMPORTANT section.
victim.post:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (POST period - after collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment Context": "Describe the post-collision scene including road conditions, any debris, and secondary hazards created.",
  "Observed Vehicles": "Describe the final positions and states of all vehicles involved after the collision.",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's final position, any damage visible, and actions taken after the collision."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by appearance.

offender.ante:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (ANTE period - before collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment Context": "Describe road conditions, weather, visibility, traffic density, and surrounding infrastructure.",
  "Observed Vehicles": "Identify all vehicles visible in the scene, their positions, and movement patterns.",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's speed, lane changes, aggressive maneuvers, or any risky driving behavior leading up to the incident."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by appearance.
offender.event:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (EVENT period - the collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Incident Report": "Describe how the POV vehicle initiated or failed to avoid the collision. What happened and how?",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's actions, any last-second braking or swerving attempts during the collision.",
  "Other Vehicle Status": "Describe the behavior and reactions of other vehicles involved in the collision.",
  "Fault Assignment": "Objectively describe how the POV vehicle's actions led to the fault assignment based on observed behavior and traffic rules."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance. This is the MOST IMPORTANT section.
offender.post:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (POST period - after collision).

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment Context": "Describe the post-collision scene including road conditions, any debris, and secondary hazards created.",
  "Observed Vehicles": "Describe the final positions and damage states of all vehicles involved after the collision.",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's final position, visible damage, and how quickly it came to a halt."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance.

witness.ante:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (ANTE period - before collision). The POV vehicle is a bystander.

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment Context": "Describe road conditions, weather, visibility, traffic density, and surrounding infrastructure.",
  "Observed Vehicles": "Identify the vehicles that will later collide, their positions, and any erratic driving behavior.",
  "POV Status": "Describe the POV vehicle's role as a passive observer in traffic."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe third-party vehicles by appearance.
witness.event:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (EVENT period - the collision). The POV vehicle is a bystander.

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Incident Report": "Describe the collision between the third-party vehicles as observed from the POV vehicle.",
  "POV Status": "Confirm that the POV vehicle was NOT involved in the impact and describe its safe position.",
  "Other Vehicle Status": "Describe how the colliding vehicles moved, interacted, and impacted each other.",
  "Fault Assignment": "Assign fault between the third-party vehicles involved in the crash based on observed behavior."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". This is the MOST IMPORTANT section.
witness.post:
Analyze ONLY the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (POST period - after collision). The POV vehicle is a bystander.

IMPORTANT: Return ONLY valid JSON. Do NOT include any prefixes, introductory phrases, or words like "thought", "analysis", "summary", "here is", or "certainly".

Return a JSON object with the following structure, where each key is a section header and each value is the body text:

{
  "Environment Context": "Describe the post-collision scene including any debris, hazards to traffic, and road conditions.",
  "Observed Vehicles": "Describe the final resting positions of the collided vehicles.",
  "POV Status": "Describe whether the POV vehicle pulls over to assist or continues past the scene."
}

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle".
